citation.article-title: Methylohalomonas lacus gen. nov., sp. nov. and Methylonatrum kenyense gen. nov., sp. nov., methylotrophic gammaproteobacteria from hypersaline lakes.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Methylohalomonas [Me.thy′lo.ha.lo.mo′nas. N.Gr. n. methyl (from Gr. n. methu wine and Gr. n. hulê wood) the methyl radical; Gr. n. hals, halos salt; Gr. fem. n. monas a unit, monad; N.L. fem. n. Methylohalomonas salt (-tolerant), methyl-group-utilizing monad].
Utilize C1 compounds as carbon and energy sources using the serine cycle for carbon assimilation.
C16 : 0, cyc C17 : 0 and 10-methyl C16 : 0 are the dominant cellular fatty acids.
The genus belongs to the Gammaproteobacteria.
Known habitat is hypersaline chloride–sulfate lakes. Methylohalomonas lacus is the type species.
